Option G is also incorrect because while "有資格" (yuu-shitsugyo) means "qualified," it does not relate to caregiving qualifications.

Therefore, the most accurate paraphrase of "未経験介護職" is "介護職（有資格）" (Kin-gai jigyo [yuu-shitsugyo]).

The term "介護福祉士" (kenko fuku shi) is a specific qualification that a caregiver must have in order to provide care and support to individuals in a professional manner.

The term "正" (sei) can have different meanings depending on the context. In this question, it is used to indicate a full-time, permanent employee. Therefore, the correct answer is Option B: 介護職（有資格）.

Option E: 介護職／パート・アルバイト - This is also incorrect, as a "パート・アルバイト" (part-time or casual worker) is not necessarily a caregiver.

Option G: 介護職（有資格）／パート・アルバイト - This is also incorrect, as a "パート・アルバイト" (part-time or casual worker) is not necessarily a caregiver.
